canonical_explanation.text: We all live in a house. Our house has different rooms like a bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, and living room. We do different things in each room. Near our house, there are many places like a school, park, shop, and hospital. All these places together make our neighbourhood. We should keep our home and neighbourhood clean.
rules: Our house keeps us safe from sun, rain, and cold.
Houses have rooms like bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, and living room.
We cook food in the kitchen and sleep in the bedroom.
Our neighbourhood has places like school, park, shop, and hospital.
We should keep our home and neighbourhood clean and tidy.

questions.question_text: Which room do we use for cooking food?
questions.explanation_correct: We cook food in the kitchen. The kitchen has a stove, pots, pans, and utensils for cooking.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bedroom is for sleeping, the bathroom is for bathing, and the living room is for sitting together. We cook food in the kitchen.

questions.question_text: Where do we sleep at night?
questions.explanation_correct: We sleep in the bedroom at night. The bedroom has a bed, pillow, and blanket.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The kitchen is for cooking, the bathroom is for bathing, and the balcony is an open area. We sleep in the bedroom.

questions.question_text: A house made of bricks and cement is called a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A house made of bricks and cement is called a pucca house. Pucca houses are strong and last a long time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hut is made of mud and straw. A kutcha house is made of mud and wood. A tent is made of cloth. A house made of bricks and cement is a pucca house.

questions.question_text: A house made of mud and straw is called a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A house made of mud and straw is called a hut. Huts are found in villages.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A flat is an apartment in a building. A bungalow is a big pucca house. A pucca house is made of bricks. A hut is made of mud and straw.

questions.question_text: Which room do we use for taking a bath?
questions.explanation_correct: We take a bath in the bathroom. The bathroom has a tap, bucket, and soap for washing ourselves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The kitchen is for cooking, the bedroom is for sleeping, and the living room is for sitting. We bathe in the bathroom.

questions.question_text: What do we do in the living room?
questions.explanation_correct: In the living room, we sit and talk with our family and guests. We also watch TV in the living room.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cook food in the kitchen, take a bath in the bathroom, and park the car in the garage. The living room is where we sit and talk with family.

questions.question_text: Where do children go to study and learn?
questions.explanation_correct: Children go to school to study and learn. In school, teachers teach us many things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hospital is where sick people go, a shop is where we buy things, and a park is where we play. Children go to school to study and learn.

questions.question_text: Where do we go when we are sick?
questions.explanation_correct: We go to the hospital when we are sick. Doctors and nurses help us get better at the hospital.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We go to school to study, to the park to play, and to the shop to buy things. When we are sick, we go to the hospital.

questions.question_text: Where do children play on swings and slides?
questions.explanation_correct: Children play on swings and slides in a park. Parks have trees, grass, and play equipment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hospital is for treating sick people, a post office is for sending letters, and a shop is for buying things. Children play in the park.

questions.question_text: Where do we buy things like rice, vegetables, and soap?
questions.explanation_correct: We buy things like rice, vegetables, and soap from a shop. Shops sell many things we need every day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: School is for studying, hospital is for getting treatment, and park is for playing. We buy daily things from a shop.

questions.question_text: A house protects us from sun, rain, and cold.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Our house keeps us safe from the hot sun, rain, cold wind, and storms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true, not false. A house does protect us from sun, rain, and cold weather.

questions.question_text: We cook food in the bedroom.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We cook food in the kitchen, not in the bedroom. The bedroom is for sleeping.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. We do not cook food in the bedroom. We cook food in the kitchen.

questions.question_text: Riya lives in a tall building with many floors. Her house is on the 5th floor. What type of house does she live in?
questions.explanation_correct: Riya lives in a flat. A flat is a house inside a tall building with many floors. Many families live in the same building.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hut is a small house made of mud. A tent is made of cloth. A kutcha house is made of mud and wood. A house on the 5th floor of a building is called a flat.

questions.question_text: Where in the house do we study and do homework?
questions.explanation_correct: We study and do homework in the study room or bedroom. We need a quiet place with a table and chair to study.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The kitchen is for cooking and the bathroom is for bathing. We study in the study room or bedroom where we have a desk.

questions.question_text: Aman wants to post a letter to his grandmother. Where should he go?
questions.explanation_correct: Aman should go to the post office to post his letter. The post office helps us send letters and parcels.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hospital is for treating sick people, school is for studying, and park is for playing. To post a letter, we go to the post office.

questions.question_text: Ram lives in a village. His house is made of mud and has a thatched roof. What type of house is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Ram's house is a kutcha house. Kutcha houses are made of mud, bamboo, straw, or wood and are often found in villages.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A flat is in a tall building, a bungalow is a big pucca house, and a pucca house is made of bricks. A mud house with a thatched roof is a kutcha house.

questions.question_text: What do we do in the kitchen?
questions.explanation_correct: We cook food in the kitchen. The kitchen has a stove, utensils, and food items for cooking delicious meals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We sleep in the bedroom, take a bath in the bathroom, and play cricket outside. In the kitchen, we cook food.

questions.question_text: A park is a place where we go to play and enjoy fresh air.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A park is a nice place where we go to play, enjoy fresh air, and see trees and flowers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Parks are indeed places where we play, run around, and enjoy fresh air and nature.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a room in a house?
questions.explanation_correct: A playground is not a room in a house. A playground is an open area outside where children play.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kitchen, bedroom, and bathroom are all rooms in a house. A playground is outside, not inside a house.

questions.question_text: Priya's mother wants to pray. Which place in the neighbourhood might she visit?
questions.explanation_correct: Priya's mother might visit a temple to pray. People visit temples, mosques, churches, or gurudwaras to pray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A shop is for buying things, a post office is for sending letters, and a park is for playing. For prayer, people visit places of worship like a temple.

questions.question_text: A big and beautiful pucca house with a garden is called a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A big and beautiful pucca house with a garden is called a bungalow. Bungalows are large houses with lots of space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hut is small and made of mud. A flat is inside a building. A tent is made of cloth. A big beautiful house with a garden is a bungalow.

questions.question_text: It is evening. The family is sitting together, watching TV, and chatting. In which room are they most likely sitting?
questions.explanation_correct: The family is most likely sitting in the living room. The living room is where families sit together, watch TV, and chat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bathroom is for washing, the kitchen is for cooking. The living room is the best place for the family to sit together and watch TV.

questions.question_text: We should throw rubbish on the road to keep our neighbourhood clean.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We should NOT throw rubbish on the road. We should use a dustbin to keep our neighbourhood clean.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Throwing rubbish on the road makes it dirty. We must always use a dustbin to keep our neighbourhood clean.

questions.question_text: What do we do on the balcony?

options.text: Enjoy fresh air and see outside

questions.explanation_correct: We stand on the balcony to enjoy fresh air and see outside. Some families also dry clothes or keep plants on the balcony.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cook food in the kitchen, bathe in the bathroom, and sleep in the bedroom. The balcony is for enjoying fresh air and looking outside.

questions.question_text: Meena's house does not have bricks. It is made of bamboo and grass. What type of house is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Meena's house is a hut. A hut is made of bamboo, grass, mud, or straw. Huts are found in villages.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pucca house is made of bricks, a flat is in a building, and a bungalow is a big pucca house. A house made of bamboo and grass is a hut.

questions.question_text: Which place in the neighbourhood helps us send and receive letters?
questions.explanation_correct: The post office helps us send and receive letters and parcels. The postman delivers letters from the post office.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The park is for playing, hospital is for sick people, and school is for learning. The post office is the place for sending and receiving letters.

questions.question_text: Anita is washing her hands and face. Which room is she most likely in?
questions.explanation_correct: Anita is most likely in the bathroom. We wash our hands and face in the bathroom where there is a tap and water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bedroom is for sleeping, the kitchen is for cooking, and the living room is for sitting. We wash our hands and face in the bathroom.

questions.question_text: All houses look the same.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Houses can be different. Some are huts, some are flats, some are bungalows. They come in different shapes and sizes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Houses are different. There are huts, kutcha houses, pucca houses, flats, and bungalows. They are made of different things.

questions.question_text: Rohit's tooth is hurting. Which place should his mother take him to?
questions.explanation_correct: Rohit's mother should take him to the hospital or a dentist. A doctor at the hospital can help fix his tooth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The park is for playing, school is for studying, and the post office is for letters. When we are in pain, we go to the hospital.

questions.question_text: How many rooms does a house usually have?

options.text: More than one room like bedroom, kitchen, bathroom

questions.explanation_correct: A house usually has more than one room. It can have a bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, and living room.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Most houses have several rooms for different activities: a bedroom for sleeping, a kitchen for cooking, and a bathroom for bathing.

questions.question_text: Where in the house do we keep our clothes?
questions.explanation_correct: We keep our clothes in a cupboard or almirah in the bedroom. This helps us keep our clothes clean and neat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The kitchen is for food items, the bathroom has soap and towels, and the balcony is open. We keep clothes in the bedroom cupboard.

questions.question_text: Sita needs to buy pencils and a notebook for school. Where should she go?
questions.explanation_correct: Sita should go to a stationery shop to buy pencils and a notebook. Stationery shops sell school supplies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The hospital is for treatment, the park is for playing, and the post office is for letters. We buy school supplies from a stationery shop.

questions.question_text: We should keep our house clean and tidy.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. We should always keep our house clean and tidy. A clean house keeps us healthy and happy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Keeping our house clean is very important. It helps us stay healthy and makes our home a nice place to live.

questions.question_text: Match the following: Kitchen is for cooking, Bedroom is for sleeping. What is the Bathroom for?
questions.explanation_correct: The bathroom is for bathing and washing. Just like the kitchen is for cooking and the bedroom is for sleeping, each room has its own use.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We study in the study room, play outside, and cook in the kitchen. The bathroom is the room where we bathe and wash ourselves.

questions.question_text: Which of these places would you NOT find in a neighbourhood?
questions.explanation_correct: A forest is usually not found in a neighbourhood. Schools, hospitals, and shops are places commonly found near our homes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Schools, hospitals, and shops are all common neighbourhood places. A forest is a large area with many trees and is usually far from homes.

questions.question_text: Mother is rolling rotis and cooking dal. Which room is she in?
questions.explanation_correct: Mother is in the kitchen. Cooking rotis and dal is done in the kitchen where there is a stove and utensils.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bedroom is for sleeping, the living room is for sitting, and the bathroom is for washing. Cooking is done in the kitchen.

questions.question_text: People who move from place to place sometimes live in a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: People who move from place to place sometimes live in tents. Tents are made of cloth and can be easily set up and taken down.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Flats, bungalows, and pucca houses are permanent homes. A tent is easy to carry and set up, so people who travel often use tents.

questions.question_text: What do we call all the places around our house?
questions.explanation_correct: The places around our house are called our neighbourhood. The school, park, shop, and hospital near our home are part of our neighbourhood.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A forest has many trees, a city is very big, and a country is even bigger. The area around our house with nearby places is called our neighbourhood.

questions.question_text: A hospital and a school are both places in our neighbourhood.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Both a hospital and a school are places found in our neighbourhood. We visit them for different reasons.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Both hospitals and schools are common places found in our neighbourhood.

questions.question_text: Grandpa is reading a newspaper while sitting on the sofa. Which room is he most likely in?
questions.explanation_correct: Grandpa is most likely in the living room. The living room has a sofa where we can sit comfortably and read.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The kitchen is for cooking and the bathroom is for washing. The living room has a sofa where grandpa can sit and read the newspaper.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a type of house?
questions.explanation_correct: A bungalow is a type of house. Parks, hospitals, and schools are places in the neighbourhood, not types of houses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A park, hospital, and school are neighbourhood places. A bungalow is a type of house â€” it is a big, beautiful house with a garden.

questions.question_text: Where would you go to borrow a book to read?
questions.explanation_correct: We go to a library to borrow books. A library has many books that we can read and borrow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hospital is for sick people, a post office is for letters, and a shop is for buying things. A library is the place to borrow books.

questions.question_text: Which of these things do we do at home?
questions.explanation_correct: We eat food with our family at home. Home is where we cook, eat, sleep, study, and spend time with family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We buy vegetables at the shop, ride a train at the station, and we don't fly planes. At home, we eat food together with our family.

questions.question_text: A flat is a house inside a tall building with many floors.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A flat is a house inside a tall building. Many families live in different flats in the same building.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. A flat is indeed a house located inside a tall building. Many families can live in the same building.

questions.question_text: Ravi is sick, Meena wants to play, and Anu wants to study. Where should each of them go?
questions.explanation_correct: Ravi should go to the hospital because he is sick, Meena should go to the park to play, and Anu should go to school to study.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sick people go to the hospital, children play in the park, and students study at school. So Ravi goes to hospital, Meena to park, Anu to school.

questions.question_text: It is raining outside. Why is it good that we have a house?

options.text: Because the house has a TV
Because the house protects us from rain

questions.explanation_correct: Our house protects us from rain. When it rains, we can stay dry and safe inside our house.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While houses do have TVs, toys, and food, the most important reason during rain is that the house protects us from getting wet.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a room found in most houses?
questions.explanation_correct: A kitchen is a room found in most houses. Every house needs a kitchen to cook food for the family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A classroom is in a school, an office is a workplace, and a garden is outside. A kitchen is a room found in most houses.

questions.question_text: We can buy medicines from a post office.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We buy medicines from a medical shop or pharmacy, not from a post office. The post office is for sending and receiving letters.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. A post office is for letters and parcels. We buy medicines from a medical shop or pharmacy.

questions.question_text: Which of these activities do we NOT do at home?
questions.explanation_correct: We do not attend assembly at home. Assembly is done at school. At home, we sleep, eat, study, and play.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We sleep, eat, and study at home. But assembly is something we do at school, not at home.

questions.question_text: Why should we keep our neighbourhood clean?

options.text: To keep everyone healthy and happy

questions.explanation_correct: We should keep our neighbourhood clean to keep everyone healthy and happy. A clean neighbourhood prevents diseases and looks nice.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping the neighbourhood clean is not about making it ugly or throwing rubbish. We keep it clean so everyone stays healthy and the area looks nice.
